DOC.detailed_description: The Family Health Development Project ( FHDP ) randomize control trial evaluate effectiveness Intensive In-home Child Adolescent Psychiatric Service ( IICAPS ) intervention , target emotionally , behaviorally , and/or psychiatrically disordered child risk psychiatric inpatient admission family . Children family randomize receive IICAPS Home-based Child Treatment Coordination ( Home-based CTC ) , home-based case management intervention coordination mental health service child . Approximately 144 child family enrol 12 month study period . Each study intervention six seven month duration , approximately 6 additional month follow-up . Data collect identified child 's parent/legal guardian three in-person assessment interview ( enrollment , end study treatment , 12-months ) , brief monthly phone interview . Data collect child psychiatric symptom behavior , child psychiatric inpatient admission service utilization , parent practice , parental problem solve skill . Additional data collect child 's teacher ( child 's behavior school ) child 's school ( day miss , suspension , expulsion , disciplinary action ) baseline , 6-months , 12-months . Service utilization data collect Connecticut Department Social Services use claim data . The main study aim evaluate efficacy IICAPS youth serious pervasive mental health problem place risk institutional placement , test hypothesis child receive IICAPS less likely exhibit out-of-control behavior less likely experience psychiatric hospitalization and/or out-of-home placement six month post-discharge service . The second study aim evaluate efficacy IICAPS youth serious pervasive mental health problem achieve , specific focus parenting practice , parental problem solve technique , parental perception child .
